result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin D Zimmerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Green Lake County Clerk of Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the court costs of $518.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.
Sentence is to commence immediately and is to be consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.

- Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- Defendant is not to have any alcohol at any place that he resides.
- Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
- Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin D Zimmerman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kevin D Zimmerman
Current: 405 1/2 Maple St, Beaver Dam, WI 53916 United States  (Effective: 10-25-2017)
Prior: 210 W. Center St, C/O Dodge County Jail, Juneau, WI 53039 United States
of hearing held on October 20, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter

1:02 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2013CF28

2 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision - Consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to have any alcohol at any place that he resides.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Court imposes the fine and costs of $3014.00.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Sentence is to commence immediately.
Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP and SAP programs.

Court grants the defendant 283 days of sentence credit.

2014CF104

3 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.  Sentence is to commence immediately.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to have any alcohol at any place that he resides.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court orders the $518.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Court grants the defendant 141 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
Dodge County Jail - 10/20/2015 at 1:00 p.m. (Sentencing after revocation of probation)
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 10-20-2015 01:00 pm

records.addlTxt:
3:04 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge.  Atty Privat concurs.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:

-court costs
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent

Court adjourned at 3:11 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin D Zimmerman
Current: 8632 State Rd 68, Fox Lake, WI 53933 United States  (Effective: 03-16-2015)
Prior: 210 Depot St, Fox Lake, WI 53933
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-06-2015 02:00 pm

3:23 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has a tentative offer and believe it may be resolved.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on April 6, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.  Address is:  8632 State Rd 68  Fox Lake, WI 53933

Court adjourned at 3:25 p.m.
Notice of Hearing for plea & sentencing scheduled on 03/16/2015 at 2:00 p.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Insufficient Address.  Unable to Forward.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

2:46 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Atty Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs to get in touch with the defendant and requests 30 days.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on March 16, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:47 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

11:09 a.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

Statement by Attorney Privat - received an offer - needs more time.

Court directs Plea/Sentencing be held after the first of the year.

Court adjourned at 11:10 a.m.
Defendant's Discovery Demand
for Discovery (Defendant's)
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.

1:37 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.  

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waive any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing.

Court adjourned at 1:39 p.m.
By Atty Barbara Privat
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

9:32 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not received a copy of the complaint.  Defendant now confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests the court read it.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court notes bond has been set - $500 signature bond.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing in approx 20 days.

Court adjourned at 9:36 a.m.
Defendant is to keep the Court informed of his address.
Bail Bond - refused to sign.
Defendant is to keep the Court informed of his address.

1:05 p.m.  Defendant in custody and in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by ADA Vanden Branden regarding charges.  Court finds probable cause.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond set at $500.00 signature bond and condition of:  Defendant is to keep the Court informed of his address.

Court adjourned at 1:08 p.m.
